segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, forming a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice, just keeps polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s too focused on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching for the cookie jar, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just waiting for something to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
